page.title: 17RELIGION IN WISTON
page.content: In Wiston there is a Church of Wales called St.Mary's.It is a norman church with a tower.For a small village the attendance is good,with a congregation of about 40 every week.The vicar,has just left to go to St.Mary's + St.Thomas church in Haverfordwest.Our new vicar has not been inducted yet. Our church is grouped with Spittal,Treffgarne,and Ambleston and we all share the same vicar,wholives in Wiston in the Vicarage next to the church.The organist in church also keeps the Post Office and Village shop.Church services are at 9.00a.m on Sundays.Just outside Wiston is South Dairy Baptist Chapel,there are 25 members.There is a Sunday School which we go to and there are 12 members.Every year we have a trip to Tenby.At the chapel I play the piano. BY LIZA AND LINDA.
